intro: Petronia regia, commonly known as the royal petronia, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant has thick, succulent stems and leaves, adapted to survive in arid environments. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Petronia regia is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
